content: spin me around © catherine bligh spin me around a simple elegant blanket that can be worked up to any size materials for a blanket approximately 48 /122 cm in diameter you will need three balls of batik swirl i used the shade purple mist hook 4 5mm use what feels comfortable to you i tend to have a tight gauge use your own judgement as to whether you want to go up or down a hook size or even two gauge after three rounds my blanket measures 3 /7 6cm across however because this is a repeating pattern matching gauge is not essential you will also need a tapestry needle for sewing in ends and you may find stitch markers helpful stitches used in us terminology chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet = double_crochet crab stitch also known as backwards single_crochet magic_ring there are many tutorials available for this if you re not comfortable with a magic_ring you can begin with the following in place of round one ch4 then 11dc in fourth chain from hook join with slip_stitch to the third chain page 1 of 4 spin me around © catherine bligh 1 in a magic_ring ch3 counts as double_crochet here and throughout then 11dc join with slip_stitch to beginning double_crochet 12 double_crochet 2 ch3 * double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in next stitch then double_crochet in next stitch** repeat from * to ** five times omitting final double_crochet join with slip_stitch to beginning double_crochet 18 double_crochet 6 ch1 24 stitches in total 3 ch3 *2dc in next stitch 2dc in ch1 space ch2 skip next stitch and double_crochet in next stitch** repeat from * to ** five times omitting final double_crochet join with slip_stitch to beginning double_crochet note you may want to put stitch markers in your ch2 and move them out as you continue to increase 30 double_crochet 6 ch2 42 stitches in total 4 slip_stitch into next stitch then ch3 *double_crochet in next two stitches and 2dc in next stitch 2dc in ch2 space ch2 skip next stitch then double_crochet
